text: Using these basic common behaviors, more complex behaviors may be coded.

text: Red harvester ants do not retain one task throughout their lifespan, but instead change their behaviors as is appropriate for the colony (Gordon, 1996).
fil_text_5: Red harvester ants do not retain one task throughout their lifespan, but instead change their behaviors as is appropriate for the colony [NAME], 1996.

text: Research has shown that red harvester ants switch tasks partially as a function of age (ex., Ingram, et al, 2005) and partially as a function of interactions with other workers (ex., Schafer et al, 2006; Gordon, 2002; Greene & Gordon, 2007).
fil_text_5: Research has shown that red harvester ants switch tasks partially as a function of age ex., Ingram, et al, 2005 and partially as a function of interactions with other workers ex., [NAME] et al, 2006 [NAME], 2002 [NAME]  [NAME], 2007.

text: Younger ants work more inside the nest, and older ants work more outside the nest.
fil_text_5: Younger ants work more inside the nest, and older ants work more outside the nest.

text: As a result, I will model the three main behaviors in the order that they are to be engaged in.
fil_text_5: As a result, I will model the three main behaviors in the order that they are to be engaged in.

text: Midden work, which consists of moving dirt between the inside of the nest and the outside, will occur first; patrolling, which involves a shorter overall amount of time spent outside, will occur second; and foraging will be the final behavior.
fil_text_5: Midden work, which consists of moving dirt between the inside of the nest and the outside, will occur first patrolling, which involves a shorter overall amount of time spent outside, will occur second and foraging will be the final behavior.

text: Finally, I will discuss a main method encoding the task switching between these behaviors.

fil_text_5: The midden work behavior will be Anties default initial behavior.

fil_text_5: Nest patrolling will involve leaving the nest, roaming around on the nest mound for a few minutes, and reentering the nest.

text: The switch from patrolling to foraging has been modeled as a function of successful foragers’ returns with great accuracy by Schafer, et al (2006), and evidence from experiments in which successful foragers were removed before reentry to the nest does support the theory that returning successful foragers have an effect on the activation of new foragers (Gordon, 2002).

text: Conclusion
fil_text_5: Conclusion

text: Antie will be a fully autonomous, situated and embodied agent, infiltrating a red harvester ant colony and providing valuable information not only about the hypothesized rules of these ants’ behaviors and their task-switching thresholds, but also about the combination of complex behaviors into a single autonomous system with the ability to switch between behaviors as necessary.
fil_text_5: Antie will be a fully autonomous, situated and embodied agent, infiltrating a red harvester ant colony and providing valuable information not only about the hypothesized rules of these ants behaviors and their taskswitching thresholds, but also about the combination of complex behaviors into a single autonomous system with the ability to switch between behaviors as necessary.

text: In addition to following these trails to the food, foragers must also be able to identify food, grasp it and carry it back to the nest.

text: Biomimetic robots have long been a rich source of information for both biologists and robotics engineers, and complex robots that can switch tasks as the situation demands and communicate information about current tasks could be useful for further studies of complex robot behaviors as well as for the obvious practical applications of robot swarms, such as on the battlefield and standard building maintenance.

text: Language plays a complex and integral role in the development and redefinition of an identity, particularly when that identity has been oppressed and subsumed by a dominant other for as long as that of the indigenous peoples in Latin America has. text: As it happens, the four countries cited, Colombia, Cuba, Panama and Nicaragua, are not only where the press is under greatest attack but also are linked by the drug trade and left-wing politics.

text: After all, conservation begins with saving those at-risk places -— our forests and deserts, wetlands and oceans, mangroves and coral reefs — that provide a lifeline for precious animals and plants.

text: To this end, we’ve designated some 200 ecoregions, those with the most outstanding and diverse habitats, as our Global 200.
fil_text_5: To this end, weve designated some 200 ecoregions, those with the most outstanding and diverse habitats, as our Global 200.

text: We’re now creating model projects in 25 of these high-priority areas -- in order to balance conservation with people’s need to use natural resources to sustain their livelihoods.
fil_text_5: Were now creating model projects in 25 of these highpriority areas  in order to balance conservation with peoples need to use natural resources to sustain their livelihoods.

text: Dear Friend,
fil_text_5: Dear Friend,

text: With your increased commitment, we can intensify our campaigns to protect species that are in grave peril by both the loss of habitat and the illegal trading in animal parts.
fil_text_5: With your increased commitment, we can intensify our campaigns to protect species that are in grave peril by both the loss of habitat and the illegal trading in animal parts.

text: Quite simply, WWF must do even more to safeguard the tigers, rhinos, pandas. whales, and other creatures that still remain in the wild.
fil_text_5: Quite simply, WWF must do even more to safeguard the tigers, rhinos, [NAME]. [NAME], and other creatures that still remain in the wild.

text: As a member of World Wildlife Fund, you know that our efforts are essential to preserving the astonishing, yet desperately threatened diversity of life here on Earth.
fil_text_5: As a member of World Wildlife Fund, you know that our efforts are essential to preserving the astonishing, yet desperately threatened diversity of life here on Earth.

text: While we still have the chance.
fil_text_5: While we still have the chance.

text: So in addition to our efforts to conserve wildlife preserves, we’ll escalate our trailblazing program to find alternatives for traditional tiger-based medicines ... rescue more rhinos in Kenya and Nepal through our ambitious translocation projects ... complete the first survey of China’s pandas in over a decade ... and fight to halt all commercial whaling, as well as the whale meat trade.
fil_text_5: So in addition to our efforts to conserve wildlife preserves, well escalate our trailblazing program to find alternatives for traditional tigerbased medicines  rescue more rhinos in Kenya and Nepal through our ambitious translocation projects  complete the first survey of Chinas pandas in over a decade  and fight to halt all commercial whaling, as well as the whale meat trade.

text: We’ll also award more small grants through our Species Action Fund to help a wide range of animals, including whooping cranes, giant river otters, and Tibetan antelopes.
fil_text_5: Well also award more small grants through our Species Action Fund to help a wide range of animals, including whooping cranes, giant river otters, and Tibetan antelopes.

text: And with your increased commitment, we can battle against destructive global forces that transcend regional and national boundaries.
fil_text_5: And with your increased commitment, we can battle against destructive global forces that transcend regional and national boundaries.

text: For instance, our innovative “Forests for Life Campaign” establishes an international network of parks and reserves.
fil_text_5: For instance, our innovative Forests for Life Campaign establishes an international network of parks and reserves.

text: “Forests for Life Campaign”
fil_text_5: Forests for Life Campaign

text: This will protect at least 10% of each different type of forest found in every country.
fil_text_5: This will protect at least 10 of each different type of forest found in every country.

text: Another WWF goal?
fil_text_5: Another WWF goal?

text: To end government subsidies that promote overfishing and to encourage new markets for sustainably managed fisheries.

text: The challenges we face are daunting, to be sure.
fil_text_5: The challenges we face are daunting, to be sure.

text: However, I’m confident that by joining together again, we can make exciting progress in the year ahead.
fil_text_5: However, Im confident that by joining together again, we can make exciting progress in the year ahead.

text: I want to ask you, therefore, to renew your valued World Wildlife Fund membership and, hopefully, at the Living Planet Society level of $750.
fil_text_5: I want to ask you, therefore, to renew your valued World Wildlife Fund membership and, hopefully, at the Living Planet Society level of 750.

text: When you do, you’ll extend your commitment as an esteemed partner with WWF -- the largest and most effective international conservation group in existence.
fil_text_5: When you do, youll extend your commitment as an esteemed partner with WWF  the largest and most effective international conservation group in existence.

text: Now, with your increased commitment, we can save more of our planet’s cherished wild species and their irreplaceable habitats ... as we strive to ensure a healthy and thriving future for our extraordinary natural world.
fil_text_5: Now, with your increased commitment, we can save more of our planets cherished wild species and their irreplaceable habitats  as we strive to ensure a healthy and thriving future for our extraordinary natural world.

text: I’m also hoping you know that you play a vital role in achieving our conservation goals around the globe.
fil_text_5: Im also hoping you know that you play a vital role in achieving our conservation goals around the globe.

text: Once again, please accept my warmest gratitude for your past support And please, take a moment today to renew your critically important WWF annual membership.
fil_text_5: Once again, please accept my warmest gratitude for your past support And please, take a moment today to renew your critically important WWF annual membership.

text: Thank you.
fil_text_5: Thank you.

text: Sincerely, Kathryn S. Fuller President
fil_text_5: Sincerely, [NAME] President

text: P.S. As a Living Planet Society member, you’ll receive the wonderful array of benefits described in the enclosed brochure.
fil_text_5: P.S. As a Living Planet Society member, youll receive the wonderful array of benefits described in the enclosed brochure.

text: Plus, to acknowledge your increased gift of $750, we’ll send you a free copy of our stunning coffee-table photography book, Living Planet Preserving Edens of the Earth.
fil_text_5: Plus, to acknowledge your increased gift of 750, well send you a free copy of our stunning coffeetable photography book, Living Planet Preserving Edens of the Earth.

text: Please let it be a constant reminder of all you’re doing to preserve our endangered wildlife!
fil_text_5: Please let it be a constant reminder of all youre doing to preserve our endangered wildlife!

text: That’s why I want to extend my appreciation for your last membership contribution of $500.
fil_text_5: Thats why I want to extend my appreciation for your last membership contribution of 500.

text: And why I’m writing you today to ask you to renew your support for the pivotal year ahead.
fil_text_5: And why Im writing you today to ask you to renew your support for the pivotal year ahead.

text: In fact, I want to urge you to strengthen your dedication to saving life on Earth — by sending a generous leadership gift of $750 and becoming a member of World Wildlife Funds prestigious Living Planet Society.

text: With your increased commitment, we can move forward to thwart the most serious threats to endangered ecosystems.
